title: The Apprentice viewers slam contestant Pamela for sexist remark as she refuses to have male team leader

The Apprentice returned to BBC One tonight with it's third episode as Lord Sugar continued his hunt for the ultimate new business partner.

Contestant Pamela Laird, 29, has been slammed by viewers after she made sexist remarks and refused to have a male contestant as her sub team-leader.

In Tuesday's week three episode, the remaining 14 stars joined the hard-talking business mogul at London's Cambridge Theatre and were tasked with brainstorming a new toy for six to eight year olds and creating an online advert to promote it.

(Image: BBC)

After last week's ice lolly episode, it was another sweet victory for the girls so this week. Lord Sugar decided to mix up the genders into two new groups, Empower and Unison.

Team leader of Empower Pamela split her team in half and refused to put a male contestant in charge of the sub-team and insisted it was a "female".

She said: "I need a girl to be in charge of you all."

Lewis complained and believed his marketing expertise could really help his team. He said: "It's not about gender, it's about skill set."

He then told the camera: "She didn't pick me because of what was between my legs."

(Image: BBC)

The Apprentice viewers instantly took to Twitter to slam Pamela for her outwardly sexist remarks.

One user wrote: "Imagine if that was the other way round. There would be a viral campaign by now."

Another posted: "Pamela just came across as a sexist? He's clearly skilled in this area and you just shut him down because he's a male?

(Image: BBC)

A third questioned:"Why do they need a woman in charge of the sub-team whether or not a man may be better qualified?"

A viewer shared:"SEXISM ALERT."

Pamela is 29 and owns a beauty brand in Dublin, Ireland.

(Image: BBC)

She attributes the success of her beauty company to her “entrepreneurial gene”, and describes herself as feisty and passionate with a charismatic personality.

She claims this combination of traits is what helps her excel in sales.

Before entering the show, Pamela acknowledged she can be impatient and demanding and admitted she often finds it difficult to delegate tasks.

She says: “I love to be the under-estimated person in the room.”
description: Team leader Pamela Laird sends Twitter into meltdown after she refuses to put a male contestant in charge of sub-team
